iati-activity.description: CAPACITY BUILDING OF EVANGELICAL LUTHERAN CHURCH IN NAMIBIA

iati-activity.title: DIVERSIFYING THE ENTREPRENEURSHIP TRAINING BY 4H NAMIBIA
iati-activity.description: DIVERSIFYING THE ENTREPRENEURSHIP TRAINING OF YOUNG PEOPLE BY 4H NAMIBIA

iati-activity.title: NGO SUPPORT / SELF-REGULATION AMONG THE MEDIA IN NAMIBIA
iati-activity.description: TO ADD CONFIDENCE OF NAMIBIAN PUBLIC AND AUTHORITIES TOWARDS MEDIA BY RE-ACTIVATING THE PROCESS THAT WILL LEAD TO BETTER ETHICS IN JOURNALISM AND SELF-REGULATION.
iati-activity.sector: Media and free flow of information

iati-activity.title: NGO SUPPORT / HANDICRAFT AND ART EDUCATION TO REDUCE DROP OUTS IN SCHOOLS
iati-activity.description: A PILOT GROUP OF TEACHERS IN THE WINDHOEK DISTRICT WILL BE TRAINED TO INTEGRATE HANDICRAFT STUDIES AMONG THEORY STUDIES TO MOTIVATE PARTICULARLY POTENTIAL DROP OUTS TO CONTINUE THEIR STUDIES.

iati-activity.title: NGO Support / Namibian Sign Language Dictionary Project (NSLDP)
iati-activity.description: To create the Namibian Sign Language Dictionary. In order to succeed the deaf community is emopowered, increase capacity to research and document locla signs. Local part-time personnel and international adviser carry out the work.

iati-activity.title: Medical Equipment Project in Namibia
iati-activity.description: Medical equipment project in hospitals around 13 districts. Reducing child death and mother's health directly, indirectly HIV/AIDS, malaria and other ilnesseses.

iati-activity.title: Administrative costs at MFA from the Embassy of Finland in Windhoek
iati-activity.description: Administrative costs at MFA, related to ODA. These costs cover all costs that can be counted (in full or percentually) as ODA at the Ministry for Foreign Affairs in Finland. Administrative costs at MFA from the Embassy of Finland in Windhoek

iati-activity.title: Frame agreement with NGO (SASK)
iati-activity.description: This project aims to elaborate a three year plan for 2010-2012 focusing on organizing, education and HIV/AIDS & gender work, with the aim to strengthen organizing level and activism of Namibian metal workers.

iati-activity.title: NGO Support / Onandjokwe Hospital Renovation
iati-activity.description: Renovation of Onandjokwe Hospital in North-Namibia

iati-activity.title: NGO Support / Psychosocial Intervention for Victims of Complex Trauma
iati-activity.description: The aim of the project is to enhance the psychological well-being. In the project education to the persons who work with the trauma victims is organised. Many Namibians experience complex trauma due to a combiation of poverty_ emotional deprivation_ hiv/aids and violence. The project will raise awareness about causes_ nature and consequences of complex trauma and possibilities for psychosocial assistance. Within a project psychotherapy is offered as well as help to the families and relatives of the victims. Also different networks to collaborate will be formed.

iati-activity.title: NGO Support / Independent Living and Social Status of the Visually Impaired_ Namibia
iati-activity.description: Improving the prerequisites for independent living and social status of the visually impaired persons in Namibia. Rehabilitation activities in the Windhoek Centre for Visually Impaired will be restarted. Cooperation partners are the Centre_ Namibian Federation of the Visually Impaired_ Rehabilitation Centre ERC of the Evangelic Lutheran Church of Namibia_ and NKL.
iati-activity.sector: Basic life skills for youth and adults

iati-activity.title: NGO Support / North-South Entrepreneurship for Development
iati-activity.description: Tentative activities of the project include: needs assessment of the NCCI regional offices; research and planning related to cultural diversity and innovation policies from the point of view of SMEs'; developing internet-utilisation capacity; developing forums for LED-dialogue between public sectors and business community; identifying and promoting business partnerships between NCCI and Finnish Federations members; piloting model of business godfarthers; piloting young entrepreneurship models at local level; and feasiblity study on women's bank approach and gender-specific piloting of SME-development.

iati-activity.title: Drafting of Uranium mining policy and Development of Minerals Database
iati-activity.description: Support for Drafting of Uranium Mining and Milling Policy, Legislation and Regulations and Development of Minerals Database, NAMUPOL.

iati-activity.title: Youth Future -project to support youth employment in Katatura
iati-activity.description: Project is focused on supporting youth employment leading to enhanced living conditions and reduced poverty levels in Katutura.
iati-activity.participating-org: Finnish NGO, Savitaipaleen Nuorison Tuki ry
iati-activity.sector: Basic life skills for youth and adults

iati-activity.title: NGO Support/ Adult education and vocational training
iati-activity.description: The object is to develop a vocational training program to better the life of uneducated rural adults, to encourage entrepreneurship and to advance the farming by decreasing bush problems in the pastures. Retort equipment will be delivered for the use of the education program and it will be utilized for clearing the pastures. The byproducts of the Retort can be sold or used for soil improvement.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Namibia
iati-activity.description: Administrative costs

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Namibia
iati-activity.description: The Walvis Bay Corridor Group was established in 2000 as a Public Private Partnership to promote the Port of Walvis Bay as one of the important gateways for SADC countries to and from, Africa, Europe and the Americas, and the rest of the world. The WBCG contributes to the overall development of Namibia and, on a regional scale, to promote regional trade and regional integration, increases import / export potential for the landlocked SADC countries, increases economical development, employment and tax revenues and thus contributing to the poverty reduction in Namibia and in the region. The Finnish support will support the objectives of the WBCG by setting up a system for gathering data from existing sources and using it for future economic analyses along the Trans Cunene and Trans Caprivi Corridors.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Namibia
iati-activity.description: The Meat Board of Namibia is a parastatal and was established under the Meat Industry Act (Act 12 of 1981). The Meat Board facilitates the export of livestock, meat and processed meat products to importing countries. The Agriculture employs about 70% of the Namibian workforce and the livestock farming it is the sectorâs most important sub-sector. The turnover of the livestock farming is worth of hundreds of millions Namibian dollars. The purpose of the project is to assess the legal, economic and environmental potential for livestock owners for the production of organic meat. This has the potential to increase the income for the farmers and revenues for the country. In addition the market potential in European markets for the organic meat will be estimated.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Namibia
iati-activity.description: Supports the strengthening of institutional, advocacy and anti-corrpution capacity of civil society and selected Government institutions. The program builds on the premise that citizen participation in elaborating and adopting public decisions is essential condition for democracy building. Through capacity building and publications the program increases capacities of polical engagement of civil society through which accountability to citizens by elected representatives is improved, and to reinforce Namibian efforts to arrest corruption to maintain transparency and integrity.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Namibia
iati-activity.description: The project aims at environmental capacity building of decision makers at all levels: enhance capacity of decision makers to address sustainable development of Namibia. The implementation happens through four components: 1) Capacity building of incipient national and regional level decision makers 2) targeted support for rural decision makers to improve their own water and sanitation management 3) team support to local authorities to enhance water and sanitation management for associated informal settlements 4) environmental updates for Namibian parliamentarians
iati-activity.sector: Basic drinking water supply and basic sanitation

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Namibia
iati-activity.description: The Project aims at evaluating the potential for cultural tourism through the establishment of King Mandume Museum. The project has five sub-components: a) To establish the feasibility and market potential for cultural tourism in the area to ascertain potential linkages with the King Mandume Museum Project. b) To consult the community and gather their input in the development of the Museum. c) Members of the Museum Development Committee will receive training on governance issues. d) A recommendation will be made regarding the appropriate legal status for the King Mandume Museum ie. e) A meeting will have been held in Angola with the relevant stakeholders and a visit made to sites of significance to the history of Oukwanyama.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Namibia
iati-activity.description: Democracy Report project will observe, analyse and disseminate information about the debates and activities of both the National Council and National Assembly. The projectâs output would be briefings, presentations, commentaries and analysis which will enable the Namibian public to better understand the role of parliament, the legislation debated by parliament, and other-related issues concerning parliamentary performance and delivery. The project will produce briefing papers on upcoming legislation; background papers on policy issues news.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Namibia
iati-activity.description: Project aims at developing sustainable energy awareness materials for energy shops that will be established in all 13 regions of Namibia, campaign materials for the information of community members, and conducting training to stakeholders in different regions. The Agreement Partner is coordiating the project on behalf of the Ministry of Mines and Energy. Therefore, the project component that is funded by the Embassy of Finland, is part of a bigger project on Sustainable Energy, which also gets funding from the Ministry of Mines and Energy.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Namibia
iati-activity.description: Project aims at creation of a human rights and democratic culture that facilitates the effective enforcement of rights, human rights laws and citizen participation. Project activities will be implemented through 5 major units of LAC, namely 1) Human Rights and Constitutional Litigation Unit, 2) Aids Law Unit, 3) Gender research and Advocacy Unit, 4) Land, Environment and Development Unit, and 5) Namibia Law reports

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Namibia
iati-activity.description: The project promotes Namibia as a tourism destination in Finland and assists in capacity building of Namibian BEE/SME enterprises.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Namibia
iati-activity.description: Unspecified old projects.

iati-activity.title: Capacity building of the Namibian prison service
iati-activity.description: Co-operation between the Finnish Criminal Sanctions Agency and Namibian prison service on on Developing the Namibian Community Service Orders and Developing the Training of the personnel of the Namibian Prison Service.

iati-activity.title: Frame agreement with NGO (Suomen LÃ¤hetysseura ry)
iati-activity.description: Community development/new. Improving the living conditions of the poorest by arranging workshops, promoting small-scale farming and small business.
iati-activity.sector: Multisector aid for basic social services
